personalInfo.education: Ferris State University (1992, Marketing and Professional Golf Management)
personalInfo.cityPlaysFrm: Royal Palm Bch; FL; United States

tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditionally Exempt: 63rd qualifier from Qualifying Tournament, Money List 61-100
tourBios.curYearHigh: Finished T3 in the PGA Professional National Championship.
tourBios.carHigh:
2012: Played in the Web.com Tour's Miccosukee Championship, where he missed the cut...Also played in the PGA Championship missing the cut there, as well. 2010: Made 10 Web.com Tour starts, the most in his career. Made five cuts. Best finish of his five weekend appearances came in his first start of the campaign. Opened with a 70 at the BMW Charity Pro-Am then improved his score each day (69-68-67) to T25...Added a T37 at the Preferred Health Systems Wichita Open, thanks to a third-round 64 at Crestview CC.
2009: Made one Web.com Tour start, missing the cut at the Miccosukee Championship despite opening with a 2-under 69. 
2008: Had a career-best Web.com Tour performance, finishing T45 at the Miccosukee Championship. Made the cut at The Honda Classic for a second consecutive year and third time overall (T74)...Qualified for the PGA Championship but missed the cut. 
2007: Was 70th at The Honda Classic, the second time he's made the event in South Florida. 
2006: Won his third career Gateway Tour title. Finished third on that Tour's money list for a second consecutive season. 
2005: Missed the cut at the PGA Championship...Won twice on the Gateway Tour. Was the third leading money-winner on that circuit. 
2003: Made the cut at The Honda Classic, finishing T67...Qualified for the U.S. Open, missing the cut...Also qualified for the PGA Championship, where he missed the cut. 2002: Played in the PGA Championship for the first time but missed the cut.
1999: Made his first Web.com Tour cut in his second career start. Was T65 at the South Florida Classic.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Winner of the 1989 Great Lakes Athletic Conference Regional Championship. Earned all-conference honors in 1989 and 1991. Team MVP in 1989.
tourBios.personal: Biggest thrill outside of golf is going to the Indianapolis 500...Favorite golf course played is Oakland Hills CC, site of numerous major championships and the Ryder Cup. Would most like to play Pebble Beach GL. Never travels without comfortable T-shirts. Favorite college team is the Connecticut Huskies. Favorite professional team is the San Diego Chargers...Superstitions include only marking his ball with a 20-punt piece from Ireland. Other favorites include "Southpark," "The Thomas Crown Affair" and "Gladiator."..Favorite entertainer is Dave Chappelle. Favorite book is Bob Rotella's Golf is Not a Game of Perfect. Favorite food is pizza and enjoys watching Tiger Woods...Lists Charleston, S.C., and Naples, Fla., as his favorite vacation destnations. Would round out his dream foursome with his dad, Kenny Perry and Payne Stewart. Most people wouldn't know that he didn't get his first cell phone until 2009.

tourBios.otherVics: (2): 2003 Sunshine State PGA Championship. 2004 South Florida PGA Open.
tourBios.curYearHigh: Finished T3 in the PGA Professional National Championship.
tourBios.carHigh:
He is a six-time South Florida PGA Section Player of the Year. 

2012: Played in the Web.com Tour's Miccosukee Championship, where he missed the cut...Also played in the PGA Championship missing the cut there, as well. 2010: Made 10 Web.com Tour starts, the most in his career. Made five cuts. Best finish of his five weekend appearances came in his first start of the campaign. Opened with a 70 at the BMW Charity Pro-Am then improved his score each day (69-68-67) to T25...Added a T37 at the Preferred Health Systems Wichita Open, thanks to a third-round 64 at Crestview CC.
2009: Made one Web.com Tour start, missing the cut at the Miccosukee Championship despite opening with a 2-under 69. 
2008: Had a career-best Web.com Tour performance, finishing T45 at the Miccosukee Championship. Made the cut at The Honda Classic for a second consecutive year and third time overall (T74)...Qualified for the PGA Championship but missed the cut. 
2007: Was 70th at The Honda Classic, the second time he's made the event in South Florida. 
2006: Won his third career Gateway Tour title. Finished third on that Tour's money list for a second consecutive season. 
2005: Missed the cut at the PGA Championship...Won twice on the Gateway Tour. Was the third leading money-winner on that circuit...Played in the Ford Championship at Doral for a second consecutive year. 
2004: Played in the PGA TOUR's Ford Championship at Doral...Won the South Florida PGA Open, setting a tournament record score in his win (23-under).
2003: Made the cut at The Honda Classic, finishing T67...Qualified for the U.S. Open, missing the cut...Also qualified for the PGA Championship, where he missed the cut...Finished T7 at the PGA Professional National Championship...Represented the U.S. on the PGA Cup team, recording a 3-0-1 record in the U.S.'s 19-7 victroy over Great Britain and Ireland...Added the Sunshine State PGA Championship title to his resume. 

2002: Played in the PGA Championship for the first time but missed the cut.
1999: Made his first Web.com Tour cut in his second career start. Was T65 at the South Florida Classic. 

1998: Made his major championship debut, at the U.S. Open. 


Amateur: Winner of the 1989 Great Lakes Athletic Conference Regional Championship. Earned all-conference honors in 1989 and 1991. Team MVP in 1989.

Would most like to play Pebble Beach GL. Never travels without comfortable T-shirts. Favorite college team is the Connecticut Huskies. Favorite professional team is the San Diego Chargers...Superstitions include only marking his ball with a 20-punt piece from Ireland. Other favorites include "Southpark," "The Thomas Crown Affair" and "Gladiator."..Favorite entertainer is Dave Chappelle. Favorite book is Bob Rotella's Golf is Not a Game of Perfect. Favorite food is pizza and enjoys watching Tiger Woods...Lists Charleston, S.C., and Naples, Fla., as his favorite vacation destnations. Would round out his dream foursome with his dad, Kenny Perry and Payne Stewart. Most people wouldn't know that he didn't get his first cell phone until 2009.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR was T67th in 2003 at the The Honda Classic.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T19th in Victory Leaders on the PGA TOUR.
